p: The patient developed dyspnoea, chest tightness and wheezing. Two days later, due to the worsening of clinical conditions he underwent to a chest CT-scan in which almost all of the right lung had a non-homogeneous increase in density, with diffuse ground glass opacity (GGO) and consolidations ( Figure 4). With nasal oxygen, SpO2 was between 85 and 90%, so Venturi mask was introduced with 60% of FO2. His level of LDH was 321 and of D-Dimer 1,785 ng/ml. Remdesivir associated with steroids were introduced, antibiotic therapy was updated introducing meropenem 3 gr once a day intravenously.
